results.title: The First animated step
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Early history of primitive film technology coupled with an explanation and examples of different types of animation. This documentary also shows how animation is achieved by both professionals and amateurs. A film for students and teachers.

results.title: First aid on the spot
results.brief_description: Six common types of injuries and disabilities and the American Red Cross technique for treating each, with demonstrations of caring for wounds, burns and schock; of controlling bleeding; splinting a fracture; and administering artificial respiraiton by both approved methods.

results.title: First aid on the dairy farm
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Cineservice and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Cases in which the farmer can be of immediate aid to his animals, before calling the veterinarian. The film deals with milk fever, pink eye, mastitis, teat injuries, administration of medicine, bloat, choke, prussic acid poisoning, wounds, first aid kit.

results.title: First aid: fundamentals
results.brief_description: Defines first aid as the first emergency help given to an injured or sick person to help ease pain and prevent further injury. Explains how to treat skin wounds, minor burns, rashes, sprained ankles, and bruises; how to administer artificial respiration; and how to stop bleeding and prevent infection and shock.

results.title: First aid: everyday emergencies
results.brief_description: Describes treatment for snakebite; poison taken internally; poison ivy, oak and sumac; chemical in the eye; soft and hard foreign matter in the eye; foreign object in the nose; bug or insect in the ear; something stuck in the throat; splinters; blisters; faintness; artificial respiration, back-pressure armlift method; carbon monoxide poisoning and electric shock.

results.title: First aid
results.brief_description: A film of historic interest: an official training film produced for the War department in three parts. Part 1: emergency treatment of bleeding wounds, including self-administration. Covers the arterial system, pressure points and application of tournequets. Part 2: emergency treatment of broken bones. Part 3: covers methods of removing the wounded.

results.title: First aid action
results.brief_description: Concentrates upon basic first aid steps. Simulated situations provide an opportunity to discuss and demonstrate mouth-to-mouth resuscitation, shock, bleeding, burns, fractures, poisoning and sudden illness. A recap is made of all first aid directions. Shots of real accidents provide realism which reinforce the film’s theme. Narrated by Burt Reynolds.

results.title: Fires were started
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings, Stewart McAllister, Ian Dalrymple and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A main contribution of Britain to the development of cinematography has been the creation of a distinctive school of film-making - the documentary film. Using non-professional actors “FIRES WERE STARTED” is the first feature film by Humphrey Jennings and is one of the most moving of the war documentaries, recapturing the typical atmosphere of the war on Britain’s civilian front. The film is a tribute to the work of the Auxiliary Fire Service, described through the events of one-day activities. The story unfolds without effort from the early morning assembly of crew at the fire station, through the routine of the day, to the fighting of a blazing warehouse at night.
